meanings.sent1: She was misawarding the prizes at the school event.
meanings.sent2: The committee realized they were misawarding the trophies.
meanings.sent3: The mix-up led to misawarding the certificates to the wrong students.
meanings.sent4: Misawarding the title to the wrong person can cause confusion.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of misawarding can be embarrassing for everyone involved.

meanings.definition: Misawarding: The act of incorrectly giving an award.
meanings.sent1: The misawarding of the medal upset the deserving winner.
meanings.sent2: There was a case of misawarding in the talent show competition.
meanings.sent3: The misawarding incident became a topic of discussion among the attendees.
meanings.sent4: The misawarding scandal rocked the prestigious award ceremony.
meanings.sent5: Avoiding misawarding is crucial to maintaining the award's integrity.

meanings.definition: Misawarding: To wrongly bestow an award.
meanings.sent1: He tends to misaward the top prize, misawarding it to the wrong person.
meanings.sent2: The judge admitted to misawarding the championship belt.
meanings.sent3: Misawarding the trophy to the last-place contestant was a humorous blunder.
meanings.sent4: She felt guilty after misawarding the recognition to someone who didn't deserve it.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of misawarding can tarnish the reputation of the awarding organization.
